modules.description: This module implements a Gaussian mixture model under the binormal assumption, enabling explicit computation of precision-recall curves and AUC. It defines a model with separate Gaussian parameters for positive and negative classes, along with the proportion of positives, and provides functions to simulate datasets, generate curves, estimate model parameters from data, and compute AUC. It is used to analyze and evaluate binary classifiers under the theoretical framework described in precision-recall curve literature.

This module processes binary classification results to build precision-recall curves and calculate area-under-the-curve metrics. It operates on datasets of scored boolean-labeled items, producing operating points and AUC estimates via trapezoidal or average precision methods. It supports statistical analysis with confidence intervals for AUC values using logit or bootstrap techniques, and includes a binormal model for simulating and analyzing classifier performance under Gaussian assumptions.
